channel.title: Deathlypvpz help
channel.description: deathlypvpz 3 have 2 world i only want 1 world how i can delete the second world ??

item.title: Deathlypvpz help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

See this:
handleStupidWorldSwitch()

Search for that. Find where it’s being used, it will look exactly as so:
handleStupidWorldSwitch();
And comment that line out so it looks like
//handleStupidWorldSwitch();

Read full topic

item.title: Deathlypvpz help
item.dc:creator: @i_pwn_u11 i_pwn_u1
item.description:
@i_pwn_u11 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:530590”][quote author=i_pwn_u1 link=topic=649351.msg4363988#msg4363988 date=1379286666]

deathlypvpz 3 have 2 world i only want 1 world how i can delete the second world ??

The “two worlds” is so the developer (ex, you) can log into localhost instead of switching the IP’s of the client.
Just disable the button if you don’t want the two worlds.

this is what i found

public void handleStupidWorldSwitch() { if(world > 1){ //STOPS MORE THAN 2 WORLD RE-WRITE LATER world = 1; }else{ world += 1; } if(world == 1){ serverip = ""+defaultServerIP+""; port = 43595; spec ="@red@Normal World"; signlink.setuid(); } else { if(world == 2){ serverip = ""+defaultServerIPw2+""; port = 43595; signlink.setuid(); spec =" @red@Hack3r`s World"; } } if(world < 0 || world > 7) spec = " Invalid world"; }

how i do disable that button?? im new to coding
[/quote]
Find it’s trigger in client.java (I’d search one of the terms that the button shows, like “Hack3rs world” or what ever) and then comment it out.[/quote]

Read full topic

The “two worlds” is so the developer (ex, you) can log into localhost instead of switching the IP’s of the client.
Just disable the button if you don’t want the two worlds.
[/quote]

how i do disable that button?? im new to coding[/quote]
Find it’s trigger in client.java (I’d search one of the terms that the button shows, like “Hack3rs world” or what ever) and then comment it out.
